snippet: President Obama sought to rekindle the passion of his 2008 victory on Saturday with a pair of huge rallies in battleground states that signaled a sharpened critique of Mitt Romney.
abstract: President Obama formally kicks off his re-election campaign; seeks to rekindle the passion of his 2008 victory with huge rallies in battleground states Ohio and Virginia that signal a sharpened critique of presumptive Republican nominee Mitt Romney.

byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Columbus and Richmond, Va. Michael D. Shear and Jeff Zeleny contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: President Obama sought to rekindle the passion of his 2008 victory on Saturday with a pair of huge rallies in battleground states that signaled a sharpened critique of Mitt Romney.

headline.seo: Obama Holds Large Campaign Rallies in Ohio and Virginia
headline.main: Obama Formally Kicks Off Campaign in Ohio and Virginia
headline.print_headline: Obama Formally Kicks Off Campaign With Rallies in Ohio and Virginia
